channel.title: Border tutorial (more than you think)
channel.description:
In this tutorial you will learn how to make a border like this (As I have seen, this border comes out better on lighter images):
[img]http://img59.imageshack.us/img59/6141/sasukedc3.png[/img]
Here is the border on my lighter siggy:
[img]http://img130.imageshack.us/img130/8489/halogy0.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 1[/b][/u] Open up an existing image. I'm using my Sasuke siggy:
[img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/530/step1yl1.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 2[/b][/u] Create 3 new layers (I suggest naming them so you know which one's which).
[img]http://img59.imageshack.us/img59/4803/step2aha2.png[/img]
And set those 3 new layers to a mode of Soft Light.
[img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/3585/step2bjo7.png[/img]
[u][b]Step 3[/b][/u] On the first layer Select>All, and then Select>Shrink, and shrink it by 1 pixel:
[img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/3669/step3ape4.png[/img]
Then Select>Invert and fill it with White.
[u][b]Step 4[/b][/u] On the second layer Select>Grow, and grow it by 1 pixel:
[img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/2752/step3brz4.png[/img]
Then fill it with Black.
[u][b]Step 5[/b][/u] On the third layer Select>Grow, and grow it by 1 pixel again:
[img]http://img258.imageshack.us/img258/2752/step3brz4.png[/img]
[b]BUT FILL IT WITH WHITE[/b].
_________________________________________________________________
Here is my finished product. (As I have seen, this border comes out better on lighter images):
[img]http://img59.imageshack.us/img59/6141/sasukedc3.png[/img]
Here is the border on my other siggy:
[img]http://img130.imageshack.us/img130/8489/halogy0.png[/img]

item.title: Border tutorial (more than you think)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Inching Away:

The frosted glass looks nice too. Go ahead and make a tut on it and use my sig.

It’s nothing too difficult; I’ll just go over it here.

Select a 2-5px border around the sig.
Filters > Sharpen Edges.
Then make another layer and fill the border area with white. And set it to soft light or overlay.

I think that’s what I did.
